name: Super Puzzle Platformer Deluxe
description: The title says it all. Take one part falling block puzzle game, combine one part old-school platformer, add a couple thousand pixels, blend and serve. Why match colored blocks when you can just shoot the hell out of them? Your goal is to survive as long as you can. From celebrated indie developer Andrew Morrish and Adult Swim Games.
minimum_requirements: OS:Windows XP SP3 Processor:2.0GHz  Memory:2 GB  GB RAM Graphics:Pixel Shader 2.0 DirectX®:9.0c Hard Drive:70 MB HD space
recommended_requirements: OS:Windows 7 Processor:2.4GHz  or higher Memory:2 GB  GB RAM Graphics:Vertex Shader 2.0 compatible card DirectX®:9.0c Hard Drive:70 MB HD space

reviews.review_text: This game is not for the faint of heart.  You may be playing as an armed piece of cheddar with massive eyebrows, but you'd best be on your damn toes in this intense puzzle platformer. But this ain't your average 'puzzle platformer', no, forget your braids and your fezzes, because this game's got GUNS, SPIKES, MISSILES, DYNAMITE, LASERS, JETPACKS, SKELETONS and BLOCK, AFTER BLOCK, AFTER BLOCK, THREATENING TO TURN YOU INTO CREAM CHEESE.  And to top it all off, this game has a BLAST PROCESSING option, which does ABSOLUTELY NOTHING.

It's very frustrating at first, because pretty much everything instantly kills you, and there are a lot of rules that you just have to learn by dying, and also some nuance to the rules that you just have to learn by accident or via the special challenges (e.g. if you jump or fall onto spikes, it instantly kills you, but if you walk onto spikes that are the same horizontal level as you, it's totally safe).  It's extremely challenging, but once you die enough to figure out what in the hell is going on, it's actually a really creative idea for a falling block game. Extremely challenging, but honestly very fun. Especially once you start unlocking alternate characters with different special abilities. (The dual wield character is my jam.)  I'll give this one the thumbs up. Especially if it's in a sale.

BEAT! # Around 4 hours  SPPD is a really fun 'score-chase' game where you basically shoot like-colored block combinations to destroy them, all the while avoiding falling blocks and traps. Every once in a while you get a 'gem'. You can move onto the next area once you have enough gems.   Simple in concept. Very entertaining in practice. Very much a 'one more round' kind of game.
Need a Mac version!
Need a Mac version!

Do you have fond memories of the Sega Genesis and Super Nintendo? Even if you don't, pick this game up; it's a ton of fun and perfect to play in short bursts. If you do, then this is seriously a no-brainer, especially when it goes on sale. From the graphics, to the simple-yet-addicting gameplay system, and especially the music, this feels like a great game from that era of consoles that was just warped through time and put on Steam.
Maybe It's me but, THIS GAME.... THIS GAME is really hard! Although It's fun to play with friends.

A fun diversion, but compared to the Flash version of this game this is an improvement, but not by enough to justify the price. Most of the new characters are not different enough to justify playing the game more (the jetpack guy is the sole exception), and the new levels add some variety, but none have much depth.  But worst of all they do nothing to fix the Flash game's biggest issue, death is often cheap with you getting insta-killed by a saw blade or a bullet you had no way of avoiding.  Do yourself a favor, save your money by either A) playing the free Flash version or B) playing Super Crate Box.
Very awesome music and platforming gameplay. This is a good action/reaction/combining game in a tetris disguise. Great quality as always by adult swim games.
Difficult. Not really fun, but challenging. The music is so-so at best. Pixel perfect spike jumps will make you rage.   5/10

Tetris but you're running around as a yellow dude with a weapon. The alternate costumes/powersets give it a bit of variety, but this is not a game I see myself keeping installed to score-attack, and even at a mere 6 levels with their own gimmicks/obstacles it felt like it was wearing out its welcome by the end. I'm honestly not sure if I recommend this or not.  In fact, I'm kinda gonna say skip it? Unless the above sounded REALLY INTERESTING to you, it's basically the entire game in a single paragraph. The 'challenges' are fun but again, really only worth doing once since they're identical every time (and I mean IDENTICAL, not just samey like the stages).
not a cool game bad but bad gameplay worst controls ever and is retro pixel thing so NO AND NO
(Any) JoyPad Support: YES! :)
This game is ingenious. My roommates and I would switch off for hours.
Really fun puzzle platformer, with sick music.

Saw this on GiantBomb a while ago but honestly forgot that I owned it. Had a game night and we ended up playing it for a while. Not really knowing the mechanics or even the buttons. After a while we were figuring out how you loose a level and what not. Very cool and retro inspired game. Sort of wish that the 'fire' buttons were on the shoulder vs. the trigger because of the delay with hitting the trigger. You can change the buttons but it is very complicated vs. just seeing the whole controller on the screen and just reassigning the buttons. Kind of wish there were more options for the characters even if it was just a color swap after you select the character.
A great little time waster.

Least puzzle-y game with the word puzzle in its name. Rhymes. It's like bejeweled and tetris but you have to avoid the falling blocks and when blocks of the same color come together, you have to break them with your chosen character with a unique moment style and weapon

Retro-style arcade action!  Fast paced gameplay puzzle shooter (Is that even a thing?) that keeps you entertained with an amazing soundtrack and great retro graphics, including unlockables, challenges and a leaderboard for you to weep over, because you can't even beat the preset scores!
WOW JUST WOW SOME OF THE BEST MUSIC IN A VIDEO GAME IVE HEARD CHECK THE MUSIC GUY OUT HE HAS ALL THE STUFF ON HIS SITE!!!! THE GAME IS NO JOKE EITHER VERY ADDICTING!!!
Awesome music, awesome gameplay, they really ♥♥♥♥ing nailed the game feeling like it's a Sega Genesis game.
THERE ARE SO MANY ♥♥♥♥ING BLOCKS AND MY TINY YELLOW MAN CAN ONLY JUMP SO FAR

+AdultSwim knows retro-style games! +quick restarts help with any frustrations you might have +why didn't someone this of this sooner  -hard -the cost of the game is a little high at $7.99....best to wait for sale.
Holy cow is this game fun! Imagine Puyo-Puyo (It's like Tetris), but with a twist. Later stages are stupidly difficult and cheap, beginning stage is probably the best for a quick and/or casual play.
Currently in the humble bundle, pretty fun and definitely challenging yet a few odd RNG deaths here and there. Would still pick it up if you enjoy challenging platforming and tetris type games.

Retro-style arcade action!  Fast paced gameplay puzzle shooter (Is that even a thing?) that keeps you entertained with an amazing soundtrack and great retro graphics, including unlockables, challenges and a leaderboard for you to weep over, because you can't even beat the preset scores!
A really good game to playy when you're ignoring lecture in class.

Like fast paced games? (just smile and nod) good. How about power ups? (just say yes so we can move this along as quick as possible I got things to do OK?) thank you. then play this game, you unlock little butter stick dudes as you go along all who have some trick that will aid you in beating the games crazy traps cannons on blocks, drills on blocks and blocks on blocks...blocks. all doing the best that they can to send you moping to the start screen over and over. some little dudes you unlock are faster(ninja dude) some are slower and more powerful (jet pack dude) play around till you find a good fit.(I dig the ninja, why? glad you asked. ninjas are pimp thats why this is a fact.) if you arelooking for a game that is cheap and not a let down and it has replay value to boot then go and get this game do it! right now!. if you do not have the money ask your mom you know she always says yes after she has been drinking. blocks
super fun and addictive, imagine playing mario ontop of a tetris level, that is super puzzle platformer dx.
